content: spiral lace hat / toque by margaretgi 2026-01-22 this toque/hat reflects a 1940 s toque pattern but that pattern was made on two needles on small size needles u s 6 / 4 0 mm and used sport / fingering yarn it took a long time to make and was lightweight for a snow hat this pattern uses aran / worsted weight yarn is knit in the round and uses u s 9 needles 5 5 mm the hat is knit in the round in three phases the brim is knit in the spiral lace pattern the middle of the hat is k1 p1 rib used to transition between the brim and the main hat the hat is then reversed by pushing it into the middle of the circular needles then the top of the hat is completed when the hat is done and the brim is folded up the pattern is spiraling in the same direction materials us 9 5 5 mm circular needles i use 24 length aran / worsted yarn 3 ounces the yarn used from the exhibit hat is red heart super saver stitch markers darning needles etc gauge 20 stitches = 4 18 row = 4 spiral lace pattern row 1 *bring yarn to front of work and slip next st purl make 1 st by letting wool pass over needle while knitting following st k2tog * repeat from *to *to end of row row 2 *k1 in slip_stitch from pervious row the wool over from previous row will be crossing in front of this stitch k1 in yarn over from previous row k1 * repeat from *to * to end of row hat pattern cast on 66 stitches or a multiple of 6 join in the round do spiral lace pattern for 4 5 ending with row 2 do k1 p1 rib for 6 row reverse the work by rolling the hat to the inside of the round needles because the work has been reversed the first row knit will be starting at the end of row just finished this action puts the wrong side of the brim facing out when the hat is finished rolling the brim up will make it match the top of the hat that is now being worked knit in spiral lace pattern until hat is 10 5 long end with 2nd row of spiral lace pattern spiral lace hat by margaretgi page 1 of 7 crown decrease the spiral lace pattern stops now and the crown is all knit stitch row 1 * k4 k2 decrease * repeat from * to end of row 55 stitches remain row 2 knit all stitches row 3 * k3 k2 decrease * repeat from * to end of row 44 stitches remain row 4 knit all stitches row 5 * k2 k2 decrease * repeat from * to end of row 33 stitches remain row 6 knit all stitches row 7 * k1 k2 decrease * repeat from * to end
